Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/06/11 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Español', 'Português', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Damien Chazelle'], 'Producers': ['Jordan Horowitz', 'Marc Platt', 'Gary Gilbert', 'Fred Berger'], 'Starring': ['Ryan Gosling', 'Emma Stone', 'Amiee Conn'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']} Review Text: I gotta tell you, I typically like Ryan Goslkng movies...but wow, this one...I can't get this time back in my life.

Review Title: It appears Gosling will take any script that comes his way... Highly recommend. Review Title: Wow is this long and full of gore. Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The analyzed purchase history reveals a preference for movies with high entertainment value, often leaning towards genres with action, humor, and adult themes. The individual consistently rates films positively when they evoke strong emotional responses or deliver engaging narratives, as seen in reviews expressing enjoyment despite initial skepticism. A tendency to watch films alongside partners, aimed at enhancing shared experiences, is evident.

Common themes in selected films include violence, substance use, and sexual content, indicating a preference for mature themes and a willingness to engage with potentially controversial material. The user demonstrates high expectations and becomes particularly critical of films perceived as disappointing or unoriginal, leading to significantly lower ratings.

Quality preferences include favoring films that deliver gripping stories and performances, particularly from known actors or directors, while exhibiting sensitivity to perceived quality over price. Explicit negative sentiments are expressed toward films that fail to meet expectations based on lead actors' reputations. A price sensitivity pattern isn't explicitly evident but can be inferred as the reviewer frequently discusses the worth of their viewing experiences.

Overall, core preferences indicate a desire for impactful storytelling, humor, and high-quality productions, while a significant aversion toward movies that feel like a waste of time or lack engagement.

target_interaction.title: A real snooze-fest
target_interaction.text:
Totally let down.

The movie did not ever seem to pick up the pace at any time, and the story line was pretty stale.
